message: Anyone want to use our collective brain power on Japan relief this weekend?
we could get the Red Cross to come do a blood drive in the lobby
I believe that was done through http://www.ushahidi.com/
Seems like ushahidi should be helping with the Japan relief as well

Google released their Japan Person Finder app... though I remember an app used for the Haiti relief effort that involved handling an individual crisis, marking criticality and location all visible on a map
Not sure how to organize this, but it's possible.. http://www.redcrossblood.org/hosting-blood-drive
Naw they use TruBlood® now
Nice. I haven't tested the waters to see what other people are doing yet. Just curious if anyone's got some ideas that might be quick to implement while we're all in one place.
This was the release for the haiti earthquake relief tracking
beats giving money to organizations that have overhead.  Nobody's going to siphon off 30% of the blood before it gets there.
nice!
probably start with concierge
http://haiti.ushahidi.com/
also, this: http://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=content.view&cpid=1221
Someone want to talk to Concierge?
Maybe this is is a dumb question, but does Red Cross actually ship blood donations overseas? That would be impressive.

On their website they also have the Safe & Well link. People in Japan can register that they're OK, and those friends and loved ones around the world can check for them there. Is used for all big disasters.
very cool
Woot! http://osmemo.wizu.jp/
true that
Maybe get more people at PyCon to donate would be my suggestion
Probably want to contact the Hyatt about organizing this
*tries to determine who you would talk to...
beats me :|

According to Wikipedia: "The Red Cross is the largest supplier of blood and blood products to more than 3,000 hospitals nationally and also assists victims of international disasters and conflicts at locations worldwide."
Not sure if that means our donations affect overseas or not.
Safe and Well looks to only be for domestic disaster relief.
unless I read that wrong
You can find out a lot about their efforts in Japan at RedCross.org
Texting REDCROSS to 90999 seems to be the most common suggestion I'm seeing on Twitter. Maybe we can just hack all the Droids and iPhones in the building to automatically send a text. :)
meh, just looks like donations
Nope. When you go to use it there is a drop down menu and the Japanese earthquake is there.
ahh okay, missed that
Be ready to use it for all the flooding we will see this spring, if you have friends or family in affected areas.
not that that's bad
just curious what more can be done
Though they link to this from redcross.org: http://www.icrc.org/Web/doc/siterfl0.nsf/htmlall/familylinks-japon-eng
Should do a lightning talk about this maybe to spread the word ...
#pyconcares ?
translators needed to complete #Sahana Eden localization. Sign up at http://bit.ly/fVTKHE
So is texting REDCROSS to 90999 the consensus way to handle this?
Just need a really simple message so it spreads and it easy to remembet
@aezellisdead Good thinking
Anyone know who we could talk to to give one or two of these ideas face time tomorrow morning?
http://japan.person-finder.appspot.com/
People at SXSW have challenged themselves to raise $10k for Japan in 4 days -- surely PyCon can set a similar goal for itself
Why don't we set a goal of $2500 by Sunday afternoon?
Would it be possible for the PSF to match at some percentage?
I have no idea how they are able to distribute funds.
@paulsmith I think that's the easiest way, yes.
I'll ask Jacob if I can give a mini-lightning talk today to announce this
I like #pyconcares
+1 for #pyconcares
People could announce they donated by hash tag, #pycon #igave or something
There are 1300 PyCon attendees. If we asked everyone to donate $10 to Red Cross, and we got a 1/5 hit rate (20%), that'd be $2600
It'd be the fastest way. We don't really want any centralized taking up of money. Too much accounting.
Or going to redcross.org to donate more if $10 is chump change.
Better hashtag than #igave? #pycongave?
@aezellisdead Considering this morning they mentioned their recovering financial status after 2009, I'm not sure what their fundage is like right now, but still good.
Do it
Plus some self-reporting, hashtag
remember
@paulsmith Awesome idea.
Yeah good point
Make it emotional.
just posted first #pyconcares on twitter :)
write a python framework for cooling down nuclear reactors?
Okay, tweet "#pycon #igave" and we'll sum them up somehow
Why not all three?
http://twitter.com/#!/nyxtom/status/46327390145744896 :D
@JoshMock They did give $10k to PyPy, so maybe they are a bit more liquid now
Maybe some of the sponsors could match with 5% going to the PSF it needs the money. Two birds. One nail. Or something.
A lot of people are using the Conventionist app, so I'd suggest we have people use #pycon too, just so it shows up in the stream in there as well
So, @paulsmith, you up for announcing using #pyconcares #pycon in a lightning talk if you can get in?
@paulsmith True. If we could scrape $2500 together, they might be able to too.
boo
Rock and roll!
http://twitter.com/nyxtom/status/46327390145744896#
Does 90999 send a confirmation back or do I just need to have faith it worked?
But it's right
@ericflo thanks for Convore, made this happen :)
Yeah! #pyconcares just showed up as the first slide for the lightning talks!
@paulsmith Thanks for the quick work!
@schmichael What @JoshMock said
@schmichael It should send a confirmation that you reply YES to
For a minute there I had a heart attack that I just advertised the wrong number
Did other people get theirs pretty quickly/
@JoshMock Hm, haven't gotten that yet. Thanks.
High five
@schmichael Maybe we just barraged 90999 and it has to catch up. :)
So spread the word, REDCROSS to 90999 and tweet #pyconcares
Wow http://search.twitter.com/search?q=%23pyconcares
Good work everyone
Maybe try again? Worst case scenario, you accidentally donate $20 instead of $10, which really isn't such a bad thing. :)
I still haven't received my confirmation response :(
I did mine before it was announced and it happened within a minute or two.
Horray! it's gained a following. thanks convore :)
@callahad Yes. On the order of 30 seconds or so.
Good news! Finally got my confirmation text. Charity confirmed!

You could see evidence of their discipline in the video footage which, unbelievable as it seems, showed workers seated at their desks typing away, while the building was shaking, with books and papers flying off the shelves around them. Incredible.

While the earthquake which struck NE Japan on Friday was tragic and catastrophic, the Japanese people are highly disciplined and resilient. They are not strangers to catastrophes both natural and man made - they will survive this too. They have a strong sense of National pride, and the biggest obstacle to overcome may simply be getting them to acknowledge they need, and then accept, outside assistance.
I just did a tally of #pyconcares hashtag with the Twitter API
I counted 43 tweets that were clearly someone announcing they had donated
There are 78 total tweets, including retweets and old school RTs
So, conservatively, $430 so far (or $780 if you think the retweets represent donations)
Conservatively, a 3% hit rate (43 / 1300 PyCon attendees)
Would be great to goose this effort -- the sxswcares effort has already raised almost $10k
http://mashable.com/2011/03/12/hello-bar-japan/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Mashable+%28Mashable%29
Here's what it looks like: http://t.co/eprEosz
I got my reply quickly.
@brianball Awesome, high five
@paulsmith Also, you must factor in that some folks could have donated more than $10
FYI: In 24 hrs, the Japanese Red Cross dispatched 62 response teams. More about the relief effort:http://rdcrss.org/gTQC9p
Currently counting ~125 #pyconcares tweets. Only about halfway to this afternoon's goal if each tweet counts as a $10 donation. Come on, people!
